net.gini.android.vision.review

Class ReviewFragmentStandard

  • java.lang.Object
    • Fragment
      • net.gini.android.vision.review.ReviewFragmentStandard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ReviewFragmentInterface

    public class ReviewFragmentStandard
extends Fragment
implements ReviewFragmentInterface

    Component API

    When you use the Compontent API without the Android Support Library, the ReviewFragmentStandard displays the photographed or imported image and allows the user to review it by checking the sharpness, quality and orientation of the image. The user can correct the orientation by rotating the image.

    Include the ReviewFragmentStandard into your layout by using the ReviewFragmentStandard.createInstance(Document) factory method to create an instance and display it using the android.app.FragmentManager.

    A ReviewFragmentListener instance must be available until the ReviewFragmentStandard is attached to an activity. Failing to do so will throw an exception. The listener instance can be provided either implicitly by making the hosting Activity implement the ReviewFragmentListener interface or explicitly by setting the listener using ReviewFragmentStandard.setListener(ReviewFragmentListener).

    Your Activity is automatically set as the listener in ReviewFragmentStandard.onCreate(Bundle).

    Customizing the Review Screen

    See the ReviewActivity for details.

      • createInstance

        public static ReviewFragmentStandard createInstance(Document document)

        Factory method for creating a new instance of the Fragment using the provided document.

        Note: Always use this method to create new instances. Document is required and an exception is thrown if it's missing.

        Parameters:
        document - must be the Document from CameraFragmentListener.onDocumentAvailable(Document)
        Returns:
        a new instance of the Fragment

      • onSaveInstanceState

        public void onSaveInstanceState(Bundle outState)

      • onDocumentAnalyzed

        public void onDocumentAnalyzed()
        Description copied from interface: ReviewFragmentInterface
        You should call this method after you've received the analysis results from the Gini API.

        This is important for managing the behavior of the Review Document Fragment when the Next button was clicked.

        If the document has already been analyzed and the image wasn't changed when the user tapped the Next button, ReviewFragmentListener.onDocumentReviewedAndAnalyzed(Document) is called and there is no need to show an AnalysisActivity or AnalysisFragmentStandard or AnalysisFragmentCompat.

        If the document wasn't analyzed or the image was changed when the user tapped the Next button, ReviewFragmentListener.onProceedToAnalysisScreen(Document) is called.

        Specified by:
        onDocumentAnalyzed in interface ReviewFragmentInterface

      • onNoExtractionsFound

        public void onNoExtractionsFound()
        Description copied from interface: ReviewFragmentInterface
        You should call this method after you've received the analysis results from the Gini API without the required extractions.
        Specified by:
        onNoExtractionsFound in interface ReviewFragmentInterface

      • setListener

        public void setListener(ReviewFragmentListener listener)
        Description copied from interface: ReviewFragmentInterface
        Set a listener for review events.

        By default the hosting Activity is expected to implement the ReviewFragmentListener. In case that is not feasible you may set the listener using this method.

        Note: the listener is expected to be available until the fragment is attached to an activity. Make sure to set the listener before that.

        Specified by:
        setListener in interface ReviewFragmentInterface
        Parameters:
        listener - ReviewFragmentListener instance
